28.98.text:
Welcome to Fieldsports Britain. Coming up
we are throwing light on Nightvision. Does

36.20.text: It is totally boring but very efficient.

38.82.text:
We have got daylight optics, Sporting Shooting
editor Dom Holtam takes an exclusive look

44.45.text: at the new Zeiss V8 Super Zoom.

45.49.text:
First, it is the King of Ferrets, Simon Whitehead,
the man who bugs bunnies. Bugs Bunnies - get

57.28.text:
When the Simon Whitehead Show rocks up with
nets, shovels, Milly, Bella, Shaggy and the

61.46.text:
Gills, (not a rock band), Sooty, and Roger
it's a bad time to be a rabbit.

67.83.text:
This travelling circus is intent on knocking
the local bunny population down. It's not

73.00.text:
sport, it's control and the farmer wants to
ensure his soon to be planted sugar beet crop

77.43.text:
is not going to get hammered. So what tricks
has the ring master got up his sleeve today?

82.96.text:
I don't normally have two dogs out together,
but I am going to today, because I need extra

88.90.text:
hands. We have stop netted the hedge, it is
very deep. We have purse netted the best looking

94.41.text:
holes. There was a bit of wire through the
middle but hopefully with the two dogs and

98.38.text:
the Sooty and Roger the other side we will
have all avenues covered. I would normally

103.68.text:
put a few hobs in this, bit of a stronger
ferret to get the rabbits to budge, but unfortunately

109.63.text:
they are now coming into breed and in their
condition I don't fancy digging down to watch

116.29.text:
ferret porn four foot under the ground. So
we will be working the gills and if I need

120.39.text:
to I will get all the gills out and just push
a hob or two through. I shan't be working

124.47.text:
them together like many people do at this
time of the year.

127.17.text:
Without any male distractions the girls have
done well this morning. Simon has already

131.45.text:
bagged a dozen rabbits before we arrive and
is sytematically working down the hedgerow.

135.93.text:
So far it's just been mature animals that
have been taken, but in this spot they find

140.50.text:
some youngsters - they're bound to it's that
time of year and either the ferrets find them

146.12.text:
What we are now experiencing is a nest full
of juvenile rabbits and unfortunately this

152.06.text:
is the difference between what we do which
is rabbit control, rabbit management and ferreting

158.43.text:
for purely the sport. Now generally this time
of the year all the sportmen have finished,

163.67.text:
they have packed up, young rabbits appear.
They want a little bounty for next year. They

167.38.text:
don't want to wipe out the rabbits because
that would put an end to their sport. That

170.51.text:
is all well and good, that is what we were
like when we were younger and growing up,

174.70.text:
but now we are asked by the farmer to come
and eradicate the rabbits, so if it means

178.25.text:
digging a nest out so be it. So this is the
mind set we have got to have. We have got

184.34.text:
to be humane, we have got to be efficient,
but at the end of the day you have got to

189.39.text:
be clinical because what a rabbit it, the
size the breed, the colour, the sex it is

194.49.text:
there for the taking and we are going to take
it.

198.24.text:
Simon has to be meticulous with the nets - a
stitch in time saves nine and even though

202.47.text:
he confesses he's an untidy person it's essential
to keep those nets in order.

206.97.text:
I am probably the most untidy person you will
ever see in your life. But if I don't take

213.74.text:
all these little bits of fur out of this net
when I go to put it back down there in 20

219.45.text:
minutes you will be hearing some industrial
languge.

222.22.text:
I have got a story about this ferret here
it is one of this year's youngsters and I

239.98.text:
actually gave it the kiss of life outside
in the field to get it to breath because it

244.13.text:
was starting to go blue and when I took it
home and put it in the hutch I didn't think

248.29.text:
it was going to last very long because it
couldn't use its back legs but because it

252.13.text:
is such a good little ferret for breeding
I left it over night, fed it, watered it,

257.16.text:
kept it under a heat lamp. In the morning
it was like a little monkey again. Right as

261.21.text:
rain. So it just goes to prove what punishment
these animals get in that horrible, violent

266.72.text:
environment there. I think a lot of people
don't give them credit for what they do. So

270.75.text:
that is why we need good press for these ferrets
and not fancy colours. So today we are going

278.05.text:
Now the last time we filmed Simon we witnessed
a very rare event - this self confessed miserable

285.21.text:
git cracked a smile, on camera, whilst talking
about "the unit", the top secret ferret cam.

290.74.text:
He says under the radar developmental work
is still being carried out at great expense

295.98.text:
at an R&D lab near Ipswich. But "smile gate"
has been hard to recover from.

301.34.text:
Well it has ruined my reputation with me smiling
and laughing and it has taken a lot of putting

305.08.text:
right. It took me a lot of money and PR media
firm to put my reputation back in tact for

315.21.text:
With his grumpy reputation restored, were
back on the case and the dogs are pouncing

319.34.text:
on those rabbits. Of course it's what's happening
under ground that's moving the rabbits and

323.60.text:
for that the ferrets have to have what simon
calls Prey Drive - assisted by their diet.

329.69.text:
Every youngster for the first eight months
of its life has nothing but wild rabbit. It

334.76.text:
improves its prey drive and get it used to
the taste, the touch, the smell and texture

338.82.text:
of it and that does make a big difference.
A rabbiting friend of mine up north Bob Merran

343.93.text:
swears by it and it is true. In our team I
have tried it. I have tested it weaned them

349.49.text:
on other foods. Nothing compares to a rabbit
fed ferret, nothing and that improves the

355.67.text:
prey drive and that is what you need. Back
to work.

358.08.text:
Simon's job is hard graft, especially when
the ferrets take it upon themselves to stay

363.38.text:
This latest bolted rabbit has lose fur - perfect
nesting material.

367.90.text:
Physiological states changing, another nest
we will be getting full of this lovely soft

372.79.text:
down. Keeps the young warm, protects them
in the nest, grab some of the foliage into

379.87.text:
make the nest, then inside the middle of the
nest would be this down to make it all nice

384.04.text:
and soft and that is why when you dig a nest
out you bring up big puff balls full of fur.

390.54.text:
If you look at how soft that is, I use Palm
oil on my hands every night and they are soft

399.01.text: as a baby's bum, but this is really soft.

402.16.text:
In this part of the world the flooding hasn't
been as devastating but Simon's aware of how

406.49.text:
damaging it's been to wildlife across the
country.

409.19.text:
We have been bolting rabbits, digging for
rabbits in half filled pipes full of water

413.09.text:
but the nests, the few that we have seen and
we have seen more today than we have done

418.17.text:
for the rest of the season we have seen a
lot of dead waxy youngsters where the water

423.04.text:
has seeped through from the heavy rainfall,
has seeped through the ground, through the

426.82.text:
warren and into the land drainage and it has
just killed them. They just can't stand it.

431.74.text:
So yes I reckon the wet weather has done a
lot of damage. Not just to rabbits, but to

437.05.text:
all wildlife. If they don't have a good breeding
season in the spring or the summer I wouldn't

442.38.text:
be surprised if next winter the rabbits where
there are localised problems will be very

449.60.text:
As a final push Simon gathers in the gills
and brings out the his big hob as the muscle.

454.85.text:
His name is Shaggy for a reason. This is the
fellow who takes all my gills out of season.

460.44.text:
He has had a vasectomy and lives the life
of Riley, don't you? Lives in a pent house,

465.37.text:
drinks perrier water and has nothing but the
finest rabbit with the fur left on and when

471.04.text:
he comes out to work for me he has to work
those little things off don't you fellow.

476.56.text:
So hopefully he is going to do it. Going to
work him on his tod because as his name describes

482.04.text:
and as you probably have seen he is well in
season so we will just see if he will work

488.11.text:
It doesn't take long for him to find himself
a rabbit and Simon goes in to help speed things

496.27.text:
It's been windy but dry and bright making
it a pleasure to be out - and simon is threatening

503.29.text:
So all in all very successful and to cap it
all you may see my head smile.

511.21.text:
He always get's his wabbit ! Now from a bunny
bugga to a news hound, it's David on the Fieldsports

529.15.text:
The Americans have got rid of Piers Morgan.
The anti-gun British chatshow host suffered

534.44.text:
from falling ratings on CNN and so lost his
job. Pro-gun groups are delighted - and so

542.50.text:
I would like to buy him a one way ticket to
any country he would like to go to.

549.82.text:
The RSPCA's future hangs in the balance. The
chief executive Gavin Grant, who preferred

554.90.text:
the RSPCA to be an animal rights group rather
than an animal welfare organisation, left

560.11.text:
suddenly last week due to ill health. After
Grant spent hundreds of thousands of pounds

565.16.text:
on prosecutions of a handful of hunts, the
RSPCA Council commissioned a review of the

570.40.text: charity's work as a prosecuting body.

573.80.text:
Tanzania is fighting it out over big-game
hunting. The Tanzania Association of Tour

579.15.text:
Operators is trying to link legal hunting,
which brings in US$75 million a year, with

585.52.text:
poaching, and wants legal hunting banned.
In reprisal, the Tanzania Professional Hunters

590.84.text:
Association is calling for heavy taxes on
tour operators to raise funds required to

598.83.text:
A church in Kentucky is finding a new congregation
by offering them guns. In what its spokesman

605.86.text:
calls "outreach to rednecks", the Kentucky
Baptist Convention is leading "Second Amendment

611.91.text:
Celebrations," where churches around the state
give away guns as door prizes to lure in nonbelievers

617.98.text: in hopes of converting them to Christ.

620.02.text:
If that is what will bring them to Jesus Christ
then that is what we will do.

624.84.text:
Viral wildlife film of the week goes to GoPro:
Hovercraft Deer Rescue. Two men who spotted

630.31.text:
deer stuck on a frozen lake in the USA used
a hovercraft to tow them off. Thanks to viewer

635.36.text: Steve McGee for sending in the link.

639.24.text:
And finally viral hunting video of the week
goes to Close Combat With Wild Boar by Pär

645.48.text:
Karlsson. You never know where that boar is
going to come from. Thanks to Mark Gilchrist

655.55.text:
You are now up to date with Fieldsports Britain
News. Stalking the stories. Fishing for facts.

664.12.text:
Next up, let's see what you lot have been
up to. It is Hallo Charlie.

674.12.text: Here is what the world is up to this week.

676.72.text:
Hallo Charlie. Black duck hunting here in
south Australia, beautiful. 84 year old gun

681.97.text: for three generations. Full bag of black duck.

684.97.text:
Hallo Charlie. John Pearce here in Newfoundland.
A little ice fishing, having some lunch, some

689.59.text:
soup and catching some brown trout. Cheers
from Newfoundland.

692.16.text:
Hallo Charlie, just with my mate carp fishing.
We had one this morning but none since. Best

700.06.text:
Hallo Charlie. My name is Lucy. I have been
out pigeoning with my Dad. It was rubbish.

710.09.text:
Send us your own Hallo Charlie. Film yourself
on your own mobile phone and sentence saying

715.86.text:
who you are and what you are up to. Then share
it or email it via Youtube, Facebook, Dropbox

720.25.text: or Younameit or Yousendit to Charlie@fieldsportschannel.tv

723.05.text:
Now affordable nightvision is bringing out
more and more possibilities, but how do we

729.75.text: ensure its future we talk about it.

734.15.text:
For an old fashioned industry we do get excited
when a new bit of technology, or should I

739.63.text:
say technology that has now become affordable,
comes our way.

743.73.text:
Night vision and thermal is transforming our
sport. It's also transforming the way we film

749.76.text:
our sport. We've witnessed some amazing foxing
and rabbitting that would have otherwise gone

757.23.text:
Seeing in the dark has been a revelation to
many sporting shooters and it's a privilege

763.07.text:
So, to ensure transparency and to promote
awareness a few of those involved with it's

768.20.text:
development and use have arranged a evening
hosted by BASC Eastern England. The audience

773.45.text:
is made up of around 70 interested shooters
who have a keen interest in where the technology

780.52.text:
is taking us, and to ensure that people don't
get the wrong end of the stick.

785.81.text:
When I am stalking about in a blacked out
vehicle wearing drab clothing, not using any

789.77.text:
ocular illumination if a bystander sees this
they think I am a peeping Tom pervert or doing

795.95.text:
something else and by ringing 101 the police
know what we are up to, or know what I am

802.23.text:
Once Simon has put his ferrets to bed, out
comes the FAC air rifle and the Night vision.

808.37.text:
He calls 101 to ensure the police know he
is out. It will not please everyone but he

814.29.text:
is pushing for a code of conduct to make we're
covered, just in case something goes wrong.

821.31.text:
Because of modern day society with people
creeping around in complete darkness, drabbily

826.01.text:
dressed, not using lights, parked up in static
situations, in the shade to the oblivious

831.81.text:
people the populous you may think you are
a burglar or something even worse. Times have

836.17.text:
changed and that's was this evenings about.
About learning, appreciating that we have

840.02.text:
got to move forward and take the blinkers
off and we have got to start realising that

845.62.text:
laws and people's opinions of what we are
doing have got to be changed and that's why

850.29.text:
if there was a code of practice then at least
there's something written down to try and

854.95.text:
prevent any unwanted accidents when you are
using this equipment.

858.15.text:
Night vision has been around in many guises
for a while - Foxing legend and author Robert

863.26.text: Bucknell has been using it for decades.

865.62.text:
It was interesting back in the last war Churchill
said " I want second best now" and first class

875.42.text:
is always down the road. The equipment is
getting better all the time and to come along

881.72.text:
to a meeting like this you're seeing all the
latest developments and hearing it and there

886.26.text:
are people here who are using the stuff and
they are going "Ah, If you do this, that's

891.31.text:
better . Try that". It's got a lot of feedback,
so a meeting like this is really good news.

897.74.text:
The one thing NV isn't, is sociable. Foxing
with a lamp requires team work but even that

903.77.text:
is now changing - the arrival of wi-fi fed
screens allowing the driver to see the action

908.80.text:
through the scope as he sits in the driving
seat will soon be commonplace.

913.73.text:
Then there's thermal. The main speaker Steve
helps develop NV systems for a US company

921.41.text:
and he suspects there will be a sporting thermal
scope-mounted add-on on the market, and not

926.84.text: for silly money, in less than 18 months.

930.25.text:
The last speaker is a Suffolk Police rural
crime officer who knows that education key.

937.27.text:
To help, BASC is offering to train new officers
who may have never come into contact with

943.64.text:
It's one of the best parts of my job doing
the training courses, because you have got

946.87.text:
young officers they have done part of their
training. Most of them come from towns and

951.47.text:
cities and they have not got the foggiest
idea. Alot of them have never seen a gun or

955.53.text:
a shotgun before . We talk about what gamekeepers
do, shoot managers, the sort of things they

960.21.text:
are likely to see. We look at trapping, all
sorts of things, just try and give them a

964.30.text:
really broad brush understanding of what they
might come across in the rural country environment.

970.61.text:
Although the night is supposed to look some
form of structure or code of practice for

974.99.text:
users the biggest discussion point is kit.
The conclusion is that all our eyes are different,

981.11.text:
so a unit that works well for one doesn't
for someone else.

985.41.text:
There will be more events like this coming
soon and maybe in your area. Visit BASC.org.uk

992.93.text:
If you have any comments about night vision
why not stick them below down on our You Tube

997.23.text:
page or on our facebook page. And if you want
to see how effective night vision is, watch

1005.66.text:
On the new show out at 7 o'clock on Thursday
the 6th of March we have Phill Price, technical

1010.42.text:
editor of airgunner and air gun world magazines
reviewing the Walther LGV and showing that

1016.79.text:
springers can do the job.That's springer air
rifles not springer dogs.

1020.88.text:
James Marchington is sorting out his trajectory
and Squirrel ranger Jerry moss explains how

1025.82.text:
to set up the most irresistible feedstation
known to squirrel-kind.

1034.82.text:
In Fishing Britain top predator hunter Antglas
Junior gets together withArun Jones to catch

1040.01.text:
20 pike on the same day using surface lures.
We explain why Jan Porter was cooking up snacks

1046.38.text:
last week. Richard Chapman sniffs out some
monk delivered wild crap andHewel Morgan is

1051.83.text:
joined by both daughters to prove that learning
to fish can be fun for all the family.

1056.99.text: Click on the link on the screen to watch it

1061.12.text:
Next week we will be bringing you the latest
kit including night vision from the IWA gun

1065.51.text: trade show in Nuremburg in Germany

1068.02.text:
One piece of kit that has been greatly anticipated
is Zeiss's new superzoom scope, the V8.

1084.19.text: Dom Holtam has had a sneak preview.

1087.74.text:
Our goal was sort of to solve the problems
the scopes had in the past, so we wanted to

1095.95.text:
have a high performance orientated scope which
is bright in comparison to the existing models

1103.51.text:
on the market which are mostly pretty much
dark with low transmission - we wanted to

1109.07.text:
solve that. We wanted to launch a super zoom
which is extremely versatile and comfortable

1115.35.text:
in use. So with a big eye relief you take
the super zoom and you automatically have

1121.59.text:
a round picture and do not have to be 100%
perfect. In the stocks you have the opportunity

1133.46.text:
I can't help but notice it has a very wide
tube. That is clearly more than the usual

1139.98.text: 30mm tube that we are used to.

1142.18.text:
Well this is the reason for the performance
orientated design. 36mm tube. We do this because

1149.01.text:
of optical performance on one hand and because
of elevation. So we have more than three metres

1156.76.text:
of elevation in the 1.8 to 14 by 50 and this
allows us to arrange an ASV + bullet compentator

1167.13.text:
with a 100 clicks and this is pure long range
performance because only having high magnification

1174.29.text:
means nothing you also have to compensate
the bullet drop on long ranges. When you zero

1178.20.text:
in on a 100 metre spot you will be using the
bullet drop compensator. You can use it up

1183.68.text:
We spoke earlier about light transmission
value. That is one thing normally sacrificed

1187.58.text:
a great deal on a super zoom scope. Do you
have light transmission figures for this product.

1196.40.text:
This is the world record in super zoom scopes.
92% light transmission and this is what you

1201.84.text:
can see in the field. You can experience it
during the last light of the day, you can

1208.57.text:
So basically every single compromise on the
super zoom has been addressed by this scope.

1214.78.text:
That was the goal of development so we worked
on them hard to solve the problems that former

1220.79.text: super zooms got. So we can say it is done.

1224.28.text: So perfect performance with zero compromise.

1228.67.text:
Just launch the Zeiss V8 is available in a
limited amount of countries around the world.

1238.51.text:
Right before we go here's some reasons to
spend another few minutes on Youtube... It's

1249.07.text:
This is Hunting YouTube, which aims to show
the best hunting and shooting videos that

1253.66.text:
We start with the channel MRAD who sends in
this film. He points out that the first step

1257.88.text:
on the way to making rabbit sausages is to
get the rabbit, and he does so with a Ruger

1262.99.text:
The Coen brothers, Powell and Pressburger
- both great picture partnerships. Now you

1268.00.text:
can watch lurcherwork and ferreting, another
superb filmic combination, sent in by Andrew

1273.66.text:
Reynolds and filmed by Andrew Reynolds. Actually,
he filmed it, sent it in and spammed the channel

1278.71.text: with it, but it is a good video nonetheless.

1280.65.text:
Less arthouse, Coastal Ferreting by Andrew
Edwards shows two lurchers, a few ferrets,

1285.26.text: no rain - a great end to the season.

1287.75.text:
Fieldsports Channel viewer Reggie Buffat recommends
this video from a German hunter, made on the

1291.68.text:
Baltic Sea near Poland. Turn on the English
captions if your German is as ropy as mine.

1296.54.text:
Anyone from the UK familiar with the angler
JR Hartley will appreciate this pile of old

1301.20.text:
schmaltz from Germany's Wild & Hund magazine,
celebrating 120 years of publication. It shows

1306.50.text:
an old hunter looking at the heads on his

1311.08.text:
A film that's been popular with Fieldsports
Channel viewers in the last week is Skinning

1314.59.text:
a Deer with a Golf Ball and Pickup Truck.
It's quick, efficient, easy - it's American

1318.88.text:
- and it's probably not something you will
do twice

1321.54.text:
Staying in North America, Nevada mule deer

1326.24.text: one of the USA' most iconic species.

And finally, 'Incredible Goose Hunting' shows

In this clip from "Mossback's Honkers Gone
